intro: Solanum sanmartinense, commonly known as the San Martín nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in Peru and Ecuador. It belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with lance-shaped leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. Its fruits are small, round berries that turn from green to yellow when mature, and the plant is often found in dry, rocky habitats.
